title: Smudges
subTitle: Different paper types and finishes absorb ink in a different way. When we print rich black, multiple thick layers of ink on top of each other, on laminated or coated paper it dries less fast and is prone to smudging.
action: Open the file in acrobat & check the 'Total area coverage' in the output preview screen.

question.text:
High ink processed?
IF DOUBT:
Run the HelloCheck on Acrobat
Check the 'Total Area Coverage' and set to 340%
Check with DTP

summaries.title: Solution
summaries.description: High ink areas processed on coated products without lamination caused the ink to spread as it needs more time to dry. We can offer a reprint on an uncoated or laminated product. Alternatively, we can ask the customer to adjust their file and remove the high coverage areas.

summaries.title: What to say to the customer
summaries.description: It seems some areas contained high ink coverage and we did not send a warning. We would like to offer you a reprint on the same product with a revised file, or a reprint on a laminated or uncoated product with the same file. If no time for a reprint, could you use this product at a discount?

summaries.title: Log in Presta
summaries.description: Artwork - Manual Checked / No Warning Sent

summaries.title: Log in Presta
summaries.description: Artwork - Automatic Checked / Autocheck - No Warning Given

summaries.title: Solution
summaries.description: Uncoated paper has a high absorbency so inks should dry quick, while laminated products have an extra layer of film over the print, both options should prevent smudges. If these are still smudged it indicates the supplier did not use the correct product, finishing or allowed plenty time to dry. We can reprint with the same file on the same order.

summaries.title: What to say to the customer
summaries.description: It seems not enough time was allowed for the ink to dry causing smudges on your product. We would like to offer to reprint the product with the same file. If no time for a reprint, could you use this product at a discount?
